page.title: 08HEDGEROW SURVEY.
page.content: In a survey each of six surveyors had a length of 30 metres of hedge to examine on small country lanes. The height of the hedges varied from 1.5- 3.0 metres. The sides were made of earth and sometimes stone on the field side.Covering it there were occasional deciduous trees,ivy, nettles,brambles and many others.The survey took place in July.The hedges were untrimmed which is unusual for this time of year and were also in a good state of repair. We found the following creatures:-froghoppers,greenfly,wasps, beetles,grasshoppers,shieldbugs,ants, blackfly,hoverflies,caterpillars,small tortoiseshell and meadow brown butterflies,dragonflies,yellow and red ladybirds.Also spiders,snails and a yellow-hammer.In the hedges we found an abundance of wild flowers and plants.We found roughly 90 different
